On Wednesday 15 October 2003 01:24, jain_prabhat wrote:

> I am coding in an Eclipse environment, from which I called the JUnit
> plugin for testing my test class which has the method as below:
>
> 	public void testPlain() throws Exception
> 	{
> 		assertEquals(1,1);
> 		assertEquals(2,1);
> 	}
>
> I always get only the result for last result:
>
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<2> but was:<1>
>
> Where as I want to design a test based on the result of first assert
> and I cannot devide them in to two test beds as the test has to be in
> single setup-TearDown. So is there any workaround for this I see lot
> of examples using multiple asserts in single test case, but why they
> are not succeeding in my case.

I don't understand your problem. The first assert succeeds: 1 = 1. The
test then proceeds to the second assert, which fails: 2 /= 1. Because it
fails, the test-case terminates. 

A test-case [ie a vode->void method who's name starts "test"] executes
until either an assertion fails, an exception is thrown [1], or you run off
the end. Tests with multiple asserts stop when any assertion fails.

What are you trying to do?

[1] Internally, the former is a special case of the latter.

--
